meanings.definition: Unwillingness or disinclination to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her reluctance to try new foods made dinner time a challenge.
meanings.sent2: His reluctance to speak in public was evident during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed reluctance to enter the bathtub for a bath.
meanings.sent4: The student's reluctance to ask questions held back their learning progress.
meanings.sent5: The dog's reluctance to leave the park showed his love for playing outdoors.

meanings.definition: Hesitation or delay in doing something.
meanings.sent1: The child's reluctance to go to bed resulted in a bedtime battle.
meanings.sent2: There was a noticeable reluctance in her voice when she agreed to the plan.
meanings.sent3: The car's reluctance to start on cold mornings was frustrating for the owner.
meanings.sent4: The reluctance of the clock to move made the waiting room feel endless.
meanings.sent5: The tree's reluctance to shed its leaves signaled the arrival of winter.
